TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit Span`1<T> extends System.ValueType
generic <typename T> public value class Span

Docs.typeparam: The type of items in the .
Docs.summary: Provides a type-safe and memory-safe representation of a contiguous region of arbitrary memory.
Docs.remarks: For more information about this API, see Supplemental API remarks for Span<T>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(void* pointer, int32 length) cil managed

Docs.param: A pointer to the starting address of a specified number of elements in memory.
The number of elements to be included in the .
Docs.summary: Creates a new object from a specified number of elements starting at a specified memory address.

remarks.format: This constructor should be used with care, since it creates arbitrarily typed `T`s from a `void*`-typed block of memory, and neither `pointer` nor `length` are validated by the constructor.

Docs.exception: is a reference type or contains pointers and therefore cannot be stored in unmanaged memory.

Docs.summary: Clears the contents of this object.

remarks.format: The `Clear` method sets the items in the <xref:System.Span%601> object to their default values. It does not remove items from the <xref:System.Span%601>.

Docs.param: The destination object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Equals (obj As Object) As Boolean

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("Equals() on Span will always throw an exception. Use == instead.")]
[<System.Obsolete("Equals() on Span will always throw an exception. Use == instead.")>]
[System.Obsolete("Equals() on Span will always throw an exception. Use the equality operator instead.")]
[<System.Obsolete("Equals() on Span will always throw an exception. Use the equality operator instead.")>]

Docs.param: Not supported.
Docs.summary: Calls to this method are not supported.
Docs.returns: Calls to this method are not supported.

remarks.format:
Calls to the <xref:System.Span%601.Equals%2A> method are not supported. Calls to the <xref:System.Span%601.Equals%2A> methods produce either of two results:
- If `obj` is a <xref:System.Span%601>, the method call generates compiler error CS1503: "cannot convert from 'System.Span' to 'object'." This is because <xref:System.Span%601> is a [ref struct](/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/builtin-types/ref-struct) that cannot be boxed and therefore cannot be converted to an <xref:System.Object>.
- If the type of `obj` is not a <xref:System.Span%601>, the method call throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
To compare two <xref:System.Span%601> objects for equality, use the <xref:System.Span%601.op_Equality%2A> comparison operator.

Docs.exception: Calls to this method are not supported.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance !T GetPinnableReference() cil managed

Docs.summary:
Returns a reference to an object of type T that can be used for pinning.
This method is intended to support .NET compilers and is not intended to be called by user code.
Docs.returns: A reference to the element of the span at index 0, or if the span is empty.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Applications should not directly call `GetPinnableReference`. Instead, callers should use their language's normal pinning syntax, such as C\#'s `fixed` statement.
If pinning a `Span<char>`, the resulting `char*` __is not__ assumed to be null-terminated. This behavior is different from pinning a `string`, where the resulting `char*` is guaranteed to be null-terminated.
## Examples
The following example demonstrates creating an integer array, pinning it, and writing each element to the console.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System/ReadOnlySpanT/GetPinnableReference/getpinnablereference1.cs"::: :::code language="fsharp" source="~/snippets/fsharp/System/ReadOnlySpanT/GetPinnableReference/getpinnablereference1.fs":::

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool operator == (Span<T> left, Span<T> right);
.method public static hidebysig specialname bool op_Equality(valuetype System.Span`1<!T> left, valuetype System.Span`1<!T> right) cil managed
Public Shared Operator == (left As Span(Of T), right As Span(Of T)) As Boolean
public: static bool operator ==(Span<T> left, Span<T> right);

Docs.param: The first span to compare.
The second span to compare.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether two objects are equal.
Docs.returns: if the two objects are equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format: Two <xref:System.Span%601> objects are equal if they have the same length and the corresponding elements of `left` and `right` point to the same memory. Note that the test for equality does *not* attempt to determine whether the contents are equal.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance !T[] ToArray() cil managed

Docs.summary: Copies the contents of this span into a new array.
Docs.returns: An array containing the data in the current span.

remarks.format: This method performs a heap allocation and therefore should be avoided if possible. Heap allocations are expected in APIs that work with arrays. Using such APIs is unavoidable if an alternative API overload that takes a <xref:System.Span%601> does not exist.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToString () As String

Docs.summary: Returns the string representation of this object.
Docs.returns: The string representation of this object.

remarks.format: For a `Span<Char>`, the `ToString` method returns a <xref:System.String> that contains the characters pointed to by the <xref:System.Span%601>. Otherwise, it returns a <xref:System.String> with the name of the type and the number of elements that the <xref:System.Span%601> contains.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool TryCopyTo(valuetype System.Span`1<!T> destination) cil managed
Public Function TryCopyTo (destination As Span(Of T)) As Boolean

Docs.param: The target of the copy operation.
Docs.summary: Attempts to copy the current to a destination and returns a value that indicates whether the copy operation succeeded.
Docs.returns: if the copy operation succeeded; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
This method copies all of `source` to `destination` even if `source` and `destination` overlap.
If `destination` is shorter than the source <xref:System.Span%601>, this method returns `false`, and no data is written to `destination`.
